front.title: Sliding Window Selective Linear Code (SLC) Forward Error Correction (FEC) Scheme for FECFRAME

abstract.t: RFC8680 describes a framework for using Sliding Window Forward Error Correction(FEC) codes to protection against packet loss, the framework significantly improves FEC efficiency and reduces FEC- related added latency compared to block FEC codes defined in RFC 6363. RFC8681 further describes two fully specified FEC schemes for Sliding Window Random Linear Codes(RLC), the schemes rely on an encoding window that slides over a continuous set of source symbols, generating new repair symbols whenever needed. This document describes a fully specified FEC scheme for Sliding Window Selective Linear Code(SLC) over the Galois Field GF (2^^8) , compared to RFC8681, this framework use a discrete encoding window which can protect arbitrary media streams selectively, and has better recovery performance in scenarios such as layered video coding or mixed streams for video streaming applications.
